title: When does I’m A Celebrity 2019 start and who is in the line-up rumours so far?
text:
Lucy Fallon, Ian Wright and Alan Halsall are all in the mix for a spot in the jungle this year (Picture: Rex/ITV/Getty)

I’m A Celebrity… Get Me Out Of Here! has proven to be a staple reality show on British TV.

The competition will soon return for its 19th series and will see an array of celebrities head into the Australian jungle for three weeks.

Last year saw football’s Harry Redknapp emerge victorious with actors Emily Atack – who has recently been revealed as a new I’m A Celebrity Extra Camp presenter – and John Barrowman as runner-ups.

When does I’m A Celeb start?

While it’s not yet been announced when I’m a Celeb will kick off, it usually begins at the end of November, with the king or queen of the jungle crowned in mid-December.

Last year, it started on Sunday 18 November, meaning it’s highly likely this year’s start date will be Sunday 17 November, which is just over five weeks away.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Who are the celebrities rumoured in the line-up?

Coronation Street actors Alan Halsall and Lucy Fallon, footballing legend Ian Wright and Love Island star Olivia Attwood are the favourites to make a move to the jungle with odds of 1/5.

Just behind at 1/3 are EastEnders’ Jacqueline Jossa and Rak-Su singer Myles Stephenson, who are also hotly tipped to join the line-up.

Jamie Laing was recently forced to quit Strictly Come Dancing due to injury (Picture: Lia Toby/Getty)

Blue singer Duncan James, Paul Hollywood’s ex-girlfriend Summer Monteys-Fullam, former rugby player James Haskell and Love Island’s Amy Hart have slightly less promising odds at 6/4.

Made in Chelsea’s Jamie Laing (7/4) and TV presenters Stacey Dooley (7/4) and Richard Madeley (9/4) are also hopefuls for the jungle.

All odds taken from Oddschecker.

MORE: I’m A Celebrity Extra Camp 2019 swaps Scarlett Moffat and Joe Swash for Emily Atack and Adam Thomas

MORE: Is Nadine Coyle latest star to sign up for I’m A Celebrity?
description: I’m A Celebrity…. Get Me Out Of will be back for its 19th series taking a new line-up of famous faces Down Under.
